review: This is a full-fps, I had my doubts about this game in the beginning. But now that I have 80+ hours under my belt this game is really addictive. If you get this game, have knowledge of working with yourself, by yourself, you can have friends but when it gets down to the last person, well,,,*** happens. The material is well done, woods, towns, cars/suv/boats,water, are very well done. There are a few things that can be made better..such, as post to the front screen that your servers are to busy or you are down for whatever the reason. This is a very hard game,but it is very good.......

author: {'steamid': '76561198012715980', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 60, 'last_played': 1554863763}
review:
Great game that offers hardcore military battle royale experience that no other games can.
Core gameplay is solid, with realistic bullet dynamics, interesting looting system, intense firefights, and strategic positioning to keep yourself alive. Will you take the risk of exposing your position to shoot now for more loots and one less competitor? Or sneak past to stay safe, conserve ammo and take better position for the next fights to come? You constantly face decisions and fast paced combat.

..... that being said I CANNOT BELIEVE how unpolished this game is. Is this really the state of a finished product that costs 30$ just for the multiplayer? I constantly face random freezes at the loading screen and server connection issues. This game has been out for 2 years. Two years! And yet the software and the server are so unstable

What's funnier is, that this game is consistently ranked within top 5 most played games among the steam platform, despite generally mixed reviews. I think the numbers speak for themselves. This game has some major issues but still damn good that people just suck it up and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975013939', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 89, 'last_played': 1554860718}
review: Bought it for the hype, and because I hadn't played a survival game. It turned out to be one of the worst games I have played. The game engine doesn't feel smooth at all, unlike other shooter games I have played (i.e., I feel like I am running/aiming under water is the best way I can explain the feeling). The servers get put on maintenance for hours and you can't even play the game during that time, oh and btw, they do this maintenance at ~9pm (in Canada) when people would be most willing to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860195172', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3509, 'last_played': 1554845607}
review:
Do you like turkish people? What about russians? Well nobody gives a fuck, you will encounter them in all your random queued games.

What about cheaters? Do you like cheats? Well nobody gives a fuck about this either, you have less than a 3% chance to NOT encounter a hacker in your next lobby. This is based off of calculations made by some intelligent individuals that started off by assuming there are at least 3.5% cheaters within the PUBG playerbase (pretty reasonable).

Oh, by the way this game is full of virgins that camp the entirety of their playtime. Your only option is to play safe and check every angle you're exposed to at any given point in time while more than 15 people are left. 

You will die by the hands of hackers, absolute cucklord campers, random idiots that kill you from the blue zone just to die 10 seconds later about 78.5% of the time. The remaning percentage goes to you actually being bad, somebody having really good aim/making very good tactical plays.

HAVE FUN! Also, friendly reminder that TPP players are real life losers.

review: It has an obnoxious price and a greedy microtransaction system. The game costs $40 like its a AAA title, yet has a store to begin with, which is bad enough, but you can also earn grates in game. You have to pay to unlock the crates though, so when it comes to gear in PUBG, You pay for it, earn it, then pay for it again. In a market saturated with battle royale games, Greed is the only thing that makes PUBG unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423297842', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1898, 'last_played': 1554827984}
review: I wish I could recommend this game as at its best it is the most addictive, immersive and engaging game i've played in years but the unfortunate truth is that the Devs are money grabbing trash who don't give a stuff about player experiences and instead farm out ridiculous skins and passes among other micro transaction garbage to fill their pockets before they inevitably kill the game. The servers are grim and the physics and movement mechanics still janky and frustrating. The most infuriating problem by a magnitude is hackers still being rife and are not dealt with in any meaningful way (probably because they are the main source of new accounts and therefore profitable) almost every game bar a scarce few are marred by cheaters (the overwhelming majority of which are chinese) which is pushing me to walking away from the game completely for the sake of my own sanity. Perhaps if the Devs actually give a damn about the playerbase and fix the issues that have plagued the game since the beginning instead of adding nonsense skins I will be able to change this review but I wont hold my breath.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114246554', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 109, 'last_played': 1554828124}
review:
I'd like to love this game, I really really really really really want to. I watch Shroud, Doc, and several other major names that play this game and they do some of the coolest stuff. Even when I watch Fitz screwing around in it, I wonder what I could do to have fun for myself, but I always come back to the same stuff every time whenever I get on;
Freezing on parachuting
Freezing when landing
Freezing when picking up a weapon
Lag when shooting

and the list goes on.

If this was like two years ago, before I bought my gaming PC and upgraded my internet, then I'd be totally understanding, but see two years ago, I didn't complain and my internet and PC were shit at the time and it was a fantastic game.

Honestly, I don't understand what the honest fuck is hell is going on. I love FPS games, but this company is turning this game into a joke.

Call my statement a heavy accusation or whatever, but it's the truth. There are thousands of fans who are less and less loyal because you play favoritism to certain people, regions, or whatever and it's pissing a lot of us off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153631657', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1547336116}
review:
Game has huge maps and if you consider yourself "not good at the game" you should drop into places that usually nobody does so you can get gears and weapons without fighting. With this way it takes like 30 minutes of looting and running untill someone somehow one shots you with their sniper. Then you repeat the same sh*t ever and ever again. If you think this is entertaining go on and buy it you will love this game. Otherwise if you are good at this kind of games you need a high-end pc. Just drop into places where most of the newbies drop and loot everything it will last less and you will enjoy it.

TL;DR i am "not good at the game" and can't enjoy the game with 1050ti usually they are killing me before i even see them so i could get my money back if i could.

Devs are like "Hey i made a game and its popular just buy it for only $40! Oh you want some cool stuff and skins? You can buy keys for $2.50 and try your luck!". Meh, money diggers...

Also there are too many hackers in game currently so, choice is yours...

review: First of all, I like playing this game very much. However, when I was prompted with something wrong, I couldn't get into the game any more. author: {'steamid': '76561198050675696', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 919, 'last_played': 1554872979}
review: I use to love this game but at this point, I feel like you guys need to completely revamp it. There are tons of cheaters and too many bugs that haven't been addressed (shot registry, d-sync, etc). These are all issues that should have been fixed in early access. Instead of hosting tournaments and selling in-game loot, maybe fix these issues first so that people who actually love the game and want to continue playing it regularly, can actually do it and enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839616714', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4711, 'last_played': 1554859382}
review:
I know this game gets a ton of hate for being a cash grab, but since I first played it, I was hooked. It is by far the most replayable game I have every owned. The only game that I got even close to playing as much was Battlefield 1, but even then, I played PUBG far more. I originally owned the game on an Xbox One X, but it was an absolute mess playing it on that. The game was locked at 30 fps and crashed constantly because it would overheat my Xbox. Also, you can imagine how difficult playing a game like PUBG is on a controller with no aim assist. Still, I had a ton of fun playing it on the Xbox and put around 150 hours into it on that. Playing on PC has been spectacular though. Playing it in 1440p at around 110 fps is a night and day difference to the Xbox. The visuals might not match some other AAA titles, but they are close. It is good to see that Bluehole is still refining the game by adding new weapons and switching up weapons like the M16, UMP, and Vector while adding the MP5K. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198065539737', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 81984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 531, 'last_played': 1554720322}
review:
SA player. I've met the below (recommended) HW specs

RECOMMENDED:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system --> Done
OS: 64-bit Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 --> Done 
Processor: Intel Core i5-6600K / AMD Ryzen 5 1600 --> Done (AMD Ryzen 5 1600X)
Memory: 16 GB RAM --> Done ()
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB / AMD Radeon RX 580 4GB --> Done (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti)
DirectX: Version 11 --> Done
Network: Broadband Internet connection --> Done (60 Mbps link)
Storage: 30 GB available space --> Done (Dedicated Samsung SSD 500 Gb // Operating System --> Sandisk SSD 500 Gb)

What else have I done?
1. Modified all video settings to the lowest (Keeping ONLY resolution to 1920*1080).
2. Created Windows Defender exclusions for SteamApps folder.
3. Created performance counters to check GPU spikes
4. Created performance counters to check CPU spikes
5. Modified the page file accordingly.
6. Tried with customized options on the launcher (Use all available CPUs and stuff)

Vikendi is impossible to play, not because people doesn't look for it, but because of an unbearable poor performance. I can't get 60 fps with the above.
You can have a game in which you get 60 ms latency, but next one will be over 150 ms until you close and re-open it (and it doesn't work every time). This is the only game in which I experience such a thing. Even in games with up to 50 ms latency, desync plays its own game.
Launching PUBG takes OVER 50 SECONDS now (It used to take 10'').
Can never play solo/duo in SA servers.
Sound "bugs" are now terrible.

At this stage when I play, I noticed I spend more time complaining about it than having a good time. The only reason why it's still installed is I keep hoping it will get better, however, when maintenance activities happen and you get a "Fixed a bug when dropping 2 bandages showing as 1 on the stairs of a house with a wooden fence in Mylta when playing FPP and weather is sunset", I honestly WILL NOT recommend to pay for it.
